column4: This might get me flamed, but.... am I the only person that thinks sudo is more of a security risk that having a root account?
And why do you think so?

I would say otherwise. Using root account is live risk. I mean I am online in root, my system gets hacked and everything is open to external source. In sudo case attacker will at least need access to shell to do any 'sudo destroy'
Yes, this is true. But when I'm online as root, I can feel free to take quite a few more precautions than I would be comfortable with as an everyday user.
